updates.text:
A pioneering research team, including Illinois Tech’s Nathan Kirk, has developed a game-changing approach using machine learning to create more evenly distributed data point sets—making estimations faster and more precise! The team’s innovative Message-Passing Monte Carlo (MPMC) technique combines graph neural networks with quasi-Monte Carlo methods, promising major efficiency gains in fields like computer vision, scientific computing, and simulation.

Imagine a group of fishermen strategically spacing out on a lake to avoid overlapping. That’s similar to how MPMC’s “low-discrepancy point sets” work, ensuring uniformity and maximizing computational efficiency. This breakthrough has already shown up to a 25x improvement in computational finance and a 4x increase in robotics efficiency. 

With MPMC, applications from light simulation in graphics to real-time robotics just got smarter, faster, and more reliable.

Learn more: https://lnkd.in/gNuby3dH
Congrats to Ryan M., a CS major at Illinois Tech College of Computing who was named the 2024 recipient of the Abraham Lincoln Civic Engagement award.

Didn’t catch the cybersecurity live session? Watch Illinois Tech’s College of Computing panel on-demand! Dive into the latest on AI, blockchain, and the future of cybersecurity—from ethical challenges to advanced malware detection and AI protection strategies.

Catch the full discussion here: https://lnkd.in/gwDf_d44

#Cybersecurity #AI

Congratulations to Ann Rangarajan, Assistant Professor of Information Technology and Management, for receiving the 2024 GenCyber Grant sub-award, sponsored by the National Security Agency! 🛡️💻

Rangarajan will lead a cybersecurity camp for high school students in Summer 2025 through Illinois Tech's Elevate College Prep Program. This initiative will help prepare the next generation of cyber experts and innovators!

Stay tuned for more updates on how this grant will shape future cybersecurity leaders.

Ever asked Alexa a question or streamed a show from the comfort of your couch? 

The tech behind your everyday life has roots right here in Chicago, thanks to Illinois Tech grads!  At our top-ranked College of Computing, we’re not just keeping up with the future—we’re building it. 

Ready to see where computing can take you?

#IllinoisTech #CollegeofComputing  #STEMEducation

https://lnkd.in/gPGytf-j

Ann Rangarajan, Assistant Professor in our ITM Department, has won the 2024 Best Reviewer Award at the Midwest Conference for Information Systems (MWAIS)! 

The award recognizes her outstanding commitment to providing constructive peer review feedback, a crucial yet often under-appreciated role in the IS research community. 

Thank you, Ann, for your dedication and contributions!
